intro: Cachrys odontalgica, commonly known as the toothache tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional medicine for treating toothaches and other oral ailments. Its leaves contain compounds with analgesic and anti-inflammatory effects. The tree thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests.
